basics.name: Niccolò Cantù
basics.label: Full Stack Web Developer
basics.summary: I'm Niccolò, a student of Digital Communication at Università degli studi di Milano. I am also a Full Stack Web Developer at KJuicer.com, a startup that works in the education field which is building an awesome tool to access knowledge in a better way. In my free time I keep myself up to date with new technologies, in particular Web related ones.

work.summary: KJuicer is a tool that allows the user to extract the knowledge from a text with a set of hierarchical highlights. As Web Developer I built the User Interface, I worked on the User Experience, I developed a Telegram Bot and an Addon/Extension.
highlights: Developed a new interface for KJuicer
Built @KjuicerBot, the Telegram Bot of KJuicer
Built a WebEXT and Firefox Addon
Wrote an algorithm to extract relevant nodes from a Web page

work.summary: Massimo wanted to enhance his clients' experience with the renewal of contact lenses. The app itself is built with React Native and the administrator dashboard is built with Firebase and React.
highlights: Developed a realtime dashboard for handling orders
Released the app on Play Store

work.summary: Everywhere Technologies has a developed an iOS app to teach maths to visually impaired children. My internship consists of a research about the cross platform issues with accessibility in particular with React Native.
highlights: The app will be released to the both stores.

volunteer.summary: As Volunteer at Mozilla I focused myself on Web Apps developed for Firefox OS, developing and publishing several apps on the Marketplace
highlights: Developed several apps for Firefox OS

volunteer.organization: ITIS (State Industrial and Technical Institute) 'Einstein' - Vimercate (MB)
volunteer.summary: As a relator in a project of work-related learning, I taught two classes how to develop Hybrid and Cross-Device Web Applications.
The Firefox Club Milano is part of the Firefox Student Ambassador Project, which aims to bring Mozilla inside the universities in order to spread the Open Web awareness.
highlights: I was invited as speaker at the University of Pavia's conference 'WTF is Technology and Future'

volunteer.summary: I partecipated at an hackathon at Mozilla Paris Office; only five participants were selected from all Europe.
I partecipated as a Mozilla Speaker to two conferences, talking about the aim of the project and the Web Compatibility.
highlights: Speaker at 'Open Source Day' in Udine, the biggest Italian events about Free Software.
Speaker at the university of Pavia's conference 'WTF is Technology and Future'

awards.title: Contributor of the Month
awards.summary: I published several apps in the Firefox Marketplace, I also wrote a chapter of the Italian 'Quick Development Guide for Firefox OS'

awards.title: Mozilla Vouched Volunteer
awards.summary: Thanks to my partecipation in the Italian Community, I have been vouched as Mozillian.

publications.name: Quick Development Guide for Firefox OS
publications.summary: In the translation by the Italian Community of the book from Andrè Garzia I inserted a chapter about using Github as hosting for Firefox OS Webapps
